holidays.name: National Toothache Day
holidays.description: A day to commiserate with anyone suffering from the agony of a toothache‚Äîand maybe remember to take better care of those pearly whites!
holidays.origin: Not officially recognized but celebrated informally to bring humorous awareness to the pain of toothaches.
holidays.funFact: People have been trying remedies for toothaches for thousands of years, from clove oil to modern dental care!

holidays.name: Read in the Bathtub Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to grab a good book and enjoy a relaxing soak in the tub while diving into a story.
holidays.origin: An unofficial quirky observance to combine two sensations of relaxation‚Äîreading and bathing.
holidays.funFact: Reading in the bath has been a guilty pleasure for centuries, even for famous writers like Marcel Proust.

holidays.name: Pizza Day (New Zealand)
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating everyone's favorite cheesy, saucy, doughy delight in New Zealand!
holidays.origin: New Zealand‚Äôs own food celebration day honoring pizza lovers across the country.
holidays.funFact: New Zealanders enjoy unique pizza toppings like mashed potatoes and beetroot slices.

holidays.name: Dread Day
holidays.description: A tongue-in-cheek day to acknowledge feelings of dread we all sometimes get about the week's challenges ahead.
holidays.origin: A humorous, unofficial observance to express common anxieties before Monday catches up again.
holidays.funFact: Despite its gloomy name, many use Dread Day as motivation to get organized and overcome stress.
